name: Apple
description: Crunchy and sweet fruit, rich in fiber and vitamin C.

name: Banana
description: Elongated, creamy fruit, a good source of potassium.

name: Orange
description: Tangy citrus fruit, packed with vitamin C.

name: Mango
description: Sweet tropical fruit, available in various textures.

name: Grape
description: Small, round fruit available in different colors, used fresh or dried.

name: Pineapple
description: Tropical fruit with spiky skin and sweet, juicy flesh.

name: Strawberry
description: Bright red berries with a sweet and slightly tart flavor.

name: Watermelon
description: Large, juicy fruit with a refreshing taste, mainly composed of water.

name: Kiwi
description: Small, tangy-sweet fruit with fuzzy brown skin and green flesh.

name: Peach
description: Soft, fuzzy fruit with a sweet and juicy flesh, rich in vitamins A and C.

name: Cherry
description: Small, round fruit with a sweet and slightly tart flavor.

name: Pear
description: Juicy fruit with a smooth texture and sweet taste.

name: Plum
description: Small, smooth-skinned fruit with sweet flesh, available in various colors.

name: Apricot
description: Small, round fruit with a velvety skin and sweet flesh.

name: Blueberry
description: Small, round berries with a sweet and slightly acidic flavor.

name: Raspberry
description: Small, red berries with a sweet and slightly tart flavor.

name: Blackberry
description: Small, dark berries with a sweet and slightly tart flavor.

name: Cantaloupe
description: Sweet, juicy melon with orange flesh and a netted rind.

name: Honeydew
description: Sweet, juicy melon with pale green flesh and a smooth rind.

name: Dragonfruit
description: Exotic fruit with vibrant pink or white flesh speckled with black seeds.

name: Passion Fruit
description: Small, round fruit with a wrinkled purple or yellow rind and tangy-sweet pulp.

name: Grapefruit
description: Large, tangy citrus fruit with pink, red, or yellow flesh.

name: Lemon
description: Tart citrus fruit used for its juice and zest in cooking and beverages.

name: Lime
description: Small, round citrus fruit with a tangy flavor, used in cooking and beverages.

name: Coconut
description: Large seed fruit with a hard shell and sweet, creamy flesh.

name: Pomegranate
description: Round fruit with a tough outer rind and juicy, edible seeds inside.

name: Fig
description: Sweet fruit with a soft, chewy texture and small, crunchy seeds.

name: Guava
description: Tropical fruit with a green or yellow skin and pink or white flesh.

name: Lychee
description: Small, round fruit with a rough, pinkish-red skin and translucent, juicy flesh.

name: Mangosteen
description: Tropical fruit with a thick, purple rind and sweet, tangy flesh.

name: Papaya
description: Tropical fruit with orange flesh and black seeds, known for its sweet taste.

name: Kiwi Berry
description: Small, smooth-skinned fruit with green flesh and a sweet-tart flavor.

name: Cranberry
description: Small, tart berries often used in sauces, juices, and baked goods.

name: Tangerine
description: Small citrus fruit similar to an orange but with a sweeter flavor and thinner skin.

name: Kumquat
description: Small, oval citrus fruit eaten whole, including the peel, with a sweet-tart flavor.

name: Persimmon
description: Orange fruit with a sweet, honey-like flavor and soft, pulpy texture.

name: Star Fruit
description: Exotic fruit with a distinctive star-shaped cross-section and sweet-tart flavor.

name: Acai Berry
description: Small, dark purple berries with a rich, earthy flavor, often used in smoothie bowls.

name: Rambutan
description: Tropical fruit with a hairy red or yellow skin and sweet, juicy flesh.

name: Mulberry
description: Small, sweet berries that grow on trees, available in various colors.

name: Acerola Cherry
description: Small, red fruit known for its extremely high vitamin C content.

name: Ackee
description: Tropical fruit with a buttery texture and mild flavor, often used in Caribbean cuisine.

name: Bilberry
description: Small, dark blue berries with a similar appearance and taste to blueberries.

name: Feijoa
description: Green fruit with a fragrant aroma and sweet, tangy flavor, native to South America.

name: Jabuticaba
description: Dark purple fruit that grows directly on the trunk of the jabuticaba tree, with a sweet, grape-like flavor.

name: Langsat
description: Tropical fruit with a thin, yellow skin and translucent, juicy flesh, similar to longan or lychee.

name: Loquat
description: Small, orange fruit with a sweet and slightly tart flavor, often eaten fresh or used in jams and preserves.

name: Nectarine
description: Smooth-skinned fruit similar to a peach but with a firmer texture and no fuzz.

name: Pawpaw
description: Large, greenish-yellow fruit with a custard-like texture and sweet flavor, native to North America.

name: Quince
description: Hard, yellow fruit with a tart flavor, often cooked before eating or used in preserves and jams.

name: Soursop
description: Large, spiky fruit with soft, white flesh and a sweet, tangy flavor, known for its medicinal properties.

name: Tamarillo
description: Egg-shaped fruit with a glossy skin and tangy flavor, available in red or yellow varieties.

name: Ugli Fruit
description: Citrus fruit with a rough, wrinkled skin and sweet-tart flavor, a cross between a grapefruit, orange, and tangerine.

name: Yuzu
description: Citrus fruit with a fragrant aroma and tart flavor, commonly used in Japanese cuisine.

name: Pitaya
description: Exotic fruit with a vibrant pink or yellow skin and white or pink flesh, also known as dragon fruit.

name: Pepino
description: Pear-shaped fruit with yellow skin and sweet, juicy flesh, native to South America.

name: Kiwano
description: Oval-shaped fruit with spiky orange skin and green, jelly-like flesh, also known as horned melon.

name: Miracle Fruit
description: Small, red fruit with a sweet, berry-like flavor that causes sour foods eaten afterward to taste sweet.

name: Atemoya
description: Hybrid fruit between cherimoya and sugar apple, with creamy, sweet flesh.

name: Feijoa
description: Tropical fruit with a fragrant aroma and sweet, tangy flavor, native to South America.

name: Physalis
description: Small, orange fruit enclosed in a papery husk, with a sweet-tart flavor and tropical aroma.

name: Tamarind
description: Pod-like fruit with a tangy-sweet flavor, commonly used in Asian, African, and Latin American cuisines.

name: Yangmei
description: Small, red fruit with a sweet and tart flavor, native to China and commonly used in Chinese medicine.

name: Pepino Dulce
description: Elongated fruit with yellow or purple-striped skin and sweet, juicy flesh, also known as sweet cucumber.
